    Basic structure

    2023-02-27

    basic.Rmd

    afscdata is a suite of utility functions for importing fishery assessment data in a consistent fashion. There are five functions at the core of the package

    • sql_read() reads ‘built-in’ sql queries, though user defined queries can be used instead,
    • sql_filter() adds species, year, and location filters to the built-in sql queries, and
    • sql_run() runs the sql code.
    • connect() connects to either the afsc or akfin server,
    • disconnect() closes the connection.

    If you have not previously done so you can use the keyring package to store your username and password, this way they are not visible when code is made publicly accessible (e.g., GitHub). Alternatively, you will be asked your username and password when attempting to use the connect() function, these values will not be stored in the the code either.

    The keyring values can be set (or changed using the following code):

    
library(keyring)
keyring::key_set_with_value(service="afsc", username="your user name", password = "your password")
keyring::key_set_with_value(service="akfin", username="your user name", password = "your password")

    With keyring in place a basic query looks like the following:

    # load ----
library(afscdata)

# globals ----
species = 'DUSK'
year = 2022
area = 'GOA'

    Open an Oracle connection (have to be in the office or connected to VPN).

    akfin <- connect(db = "akfin")

    Get the SQL query. Alternatively, a user supplied query could be used in place of files installed with this package.

    catch <- sql_read('fsh_catch.sql')
catch
#>  [1] "SELECT "                             "  year,"                            
#>  [3] "  species_group_name,"               "  species_name as species,"         
#>  [5] "  species_group_code,"               "  retained_or_discarded,"           
#>  [7] "  trip_target_code,"                 "  cdq_flag as cdq,"                 
#>  [9] "  fmp_gear as gear,"                 "  fmp_area,"                        
#> [11] "  fmp_subarea,"                      "  week_end_date,"                   
#> [13] "  weight_posted as tons"             "FROM council.comprehensive_blend_ca"
#> [15] "WHERE fmp_area"                      "-- insert area"                     
#> [17] "AND year"                            "-- insert year"                     
#> [19] "AND species_group_code"              "-- insert species"

    Filter the SQL query.

    catch <- sql_filter(x = species, sql_code = catch, flag = "-- insert species")
catch <- sql_filter(x = year, sql_code = catch, flag = "-- insert year")
catch <- sql_filter(x = area, sql_code = catch, flag = "-- insert area")
catch
#>  [1] "SELECT "                             "  year,"                            
#>  [3] "  species_group_name,"               "  species_name as species,"         
#>  [5] "  species_group_code,"               "  retained_or_discarded,"           
#>  [7] "  trip_target_code,"                 "  cdq_flag as cdq,"                 
#>  [9] "  fmp_gear as gear,"                 "  fmp_area,"                        
#> [11] "  fmp_subarea,"                      "  week_end_date,"                   
#> [13] "  weight_posted as tons"             "FROM council.comprehensive_blend_ca"
#> [15] "WHERE fmp_area"                      "IN ('GOA')"                         
#> [17] "AND year"                            "IN ('2022')"                        
#> [19] "AND species_group_code"              "IN ('DUSK')"

    Run the SQL query.

    sql_run(akfin, catch)

    Close the connection.

    disconnect(akfin)

    Developed by Benjamin Williams.
